message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you the opportunity to purchase this product. Given its value, I'm initially proposing a price of $20,000. I believe this is a fair reflection of its worth.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I'm willing to pay a maximum of $18,000 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering its value to me.
Bob, I understand your perspective on the value. While I'm willing to negotiate, $18,000 is a bit too low for me. How about we meet in the middle at $19,000? This considers both our positions.

I appreciate your willingness to meet in the middle, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to pay $17,500 for the product. I believe this is a fair compromise considering the value I'll get from it.
Bob, I'm sensing we're getting closer. While $17,500 is a bit too low, I'm willing to come down to $18,500. This is a significant compromise on my end and reflects my desire to reach a deal.

I appreciate your willingness to come down to $18,500, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to pay $17,000 for the product. I believe this is a fair compromise considering the value I'll get from it.
